REVIEW.TITLE: F3 Real-Time Implementation of a Retinal Model
REVIEW.SUMMARY: To encode, in parallel and in real-time, video frames into high-resolution neuronal input (spikes).
REVIEW.DETAILED_COMMENTS:
The way you introduced your research and related concepts is clear and neat. Section I flows naturally from the problem to the proposed solution. Section 2 explains the necessary background knowledge to understand your work.
- Are the research goals clear? Yes - Are the contributions clearly indicated? - Is the paper well-organized and well-written? Yes, it is well organized although it has some grammar and spelling mistakes (e.g. Section 2,Paragraph 2, line 3; Section 4, Paragraph 1, Line 1) - Does it use standard terminology? Yes - Are there sufficient details to replicate the work? Almost, see coments on Section 4.2 - Are the representation and algorithms clearly explained? Yes - Does the paper include enough examples? Yes, work in progress. - Does the author carefully evaluate the approach? The author mentions an evaluation process called "Reconstruction procedure". I think it is important to mention what is the evaluation criteria for the reconstructed images (quality of Fig 4(a) vs Fig 4(b) vs Fig 4(c)). Are there any quantitative methods to do this? - Is there any theoretical analysis of the results? There are not results yet, work in progress. - Does the paper give evidence of generality? Yes
